name: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychological thriller about a woman who shoots her husband and refuses to speak ever again.

name: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A mystery novel revolving around the disappearance of a woman, sparking a media frenzy.

name: The Girl on the Train
author: Paula Hawkins
description: A psychological thriller that explores the complex relationships between three women.

name: Before I Go to Sleep
author: S.J. Watson
description: A woman with amnesia tries to piece together her life, only to discover unsettling truths.

name: The Couple Next Door
author: Shari Lapena
description: A couple’s baby goes missing, and their lives spiral as they become suspects in the crime.

name: Behind Closed Doors
author: B.A. Paris
description: A psychological thriller about a seemingly perfect marriage hiding dark secrets.

name: The Reversal
author: Michael Connelly
description: A criminal defense attorney is recruited to help clear the name of a convicted criminal.

name: The Woman in the Window
author: A.J. Finn
description: A woman, confined to her home, believes she has witnessed a crime in the house next door.

name: Naruto Vol. 1
author: Masashi Kishimoto
description: The story of Naruto Uzumaki, a young ninja determined to become the Hokage of his village.

name: Attack on Titan Vol. 1
author: Hajime Isayama
description: Humanity fights to survive against titans, giant humanoid creatures that eat people.

name: Death Note Vol. 1
author: Tsugumi Ohba
description: A high school student gains the power to kill anyone whose name he writes in a mysterious notebook.

name: One Piece Vol. 1
author: Eiichiro Oda
description: Monkey D. Luffy sets off on a journey to find the legendary treasure, the One Piece, and become the Pirate King.

name: Bleach Vol. 1
author: Tite Kubo
description: Ichigo Kurosaki, a teenager with the ability to see ghosts, becomes a Soul Reaper to protect the living.

name: Demon Slayer Vol. 1
author: Koyoharu Gotouge
description: Tanjiro Kamado becomes a demon slayer to avenge his family and cure his sister, who has been turned into a demon.

name: My Hero Academia Vol. 1
author: Kohei Horikoshi
description: In a world where people have superpowers called Quirks, Izuku Midoriya dreams of becoming a hero.

name: Tokyo Ghoul Vol. 1
author: Sui Ishida
description: Ken Kaneki becomes a half-ghoul after a deadly encounter, struggling to live between human and ghoul worlds.

name: The Notebook
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: A heartwarming love story about a couple’s enduring romance despite challenges over the years.

name: Me Before You
author: Jojo Moyes
description: A woman becomes a caregiver to a man who is paralyzed, leading to an unexpected and life-changing romance.

name: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic love story of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy, filled with wit, humor, and social commentary.

name: Twilight
author: Stephenie Meyer
description: A teenager falls in love with a vampire, beginning an intense and dangerous relationship.

name: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: A poignant love story about two teenagers battling cancer and learning to live with the reality of their illnesses.

name: Outlander
author: Diana Gabaldon
description: A time-traveling historical romance where a woman from the 1940s finds herself in 18th-century Scotland.

name: The Rosie Project
author: Graeme Simsion
description: A socially awkward genetics professor embarks on a quest to find a wife, with unexpected results.

name: Fifty Shades of Grey
author: E.L. James
description: A passionate and complicated romance between a young woman and a wealthy businessman.

name: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: A groundbreaking exploration of how we think, exploring the two systems of thinking that drive our decisions.

name: The Power of Habit
author: Charles Duhigg
description: A deep dive into the science of habits, explaining how they work and how we can change them.

name: Influence
author: Robert B. Cialdini
description: A classic work on the psychology of persuasion, explaining the six principles that drive people to say 'yes.'

name: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: A practical guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones, based on scientific research.

name: Man's Search for Meaning
author: Viktor Frankl
description: A psychological exploration of the human will to find meaning in life, even in the most difficult of circumstances.

name: Grit
author: Angela Duckworth
description: An exploration of the power of perseverance and passion in achieving long-term goals.

name: Quiet
author: Susan Cain
description: A look at the power of introverts in a world that values extroversion, exploring how introverts thrive.

name: Drive
author: Daniel H. Pink
description: An exploration of the science behind motivation and how people are driven to succeed.

name: The Pragmatic Programmer
author: Andrew Hunt, David Thomas
description: A timeless guide to being an effective and adaptable programmer, with practical advice on software development.

name: Clean Code
author: Robert C. Martin
description: A guide to writing clean, maintainable code and improving software quality.

name: You Don't Know JS
author: Kyle Simpson
description: An in-depth series about JavaScript, covering both fundamental and advanced concepts.

name: The Art of Computer Programming
author: Donald E. Knuth
description: A comprehensive series on algorithms and computer programming by one of the pioneers in the field.

name: Introduction to Algorithms
author: Thomas H. Cormen, Charles E. Leiserson
description: A textbook that provides comprehensive coverage of algorithms and data structures.

name: The Mythical Man-Month
author: Frederick P. Brooks Jr.
description: A collection of essays on software engineering, project management, and team dynamics.

name: Design Patterns
author: Erich Gamma, Richard Helm
description: A guide to understanding and applying software design patterns for better system architecture.

name: Refactoring
author: Martin Fowler
description: A book on improving the design of existing code without changing its behavior, using refactoring techniques.

name: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story about the American dream, exploring themes of wealth, love, and betrayal in 1920s New York.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance and propaganda to control its citizens.

name: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic novel of manners, dealing with themes of love, reputation, and class in early 19th century England.

name: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: The story of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the great white whale, Moby-Dick.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A young man's journey through adolescence, dealing with themes of alienation, identity, and mental health.

name: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic high fantasy novel that follows a group of friends on a mission to destroy a powerful artifact and defeat evil forces.

name: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian novel exploring themes of technology, control, and individual freedom in a future society.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A powerful tale of racism and justice in the American South, told through the eyes of a young girl.
